text: The 2020 United States Census, known as Census 2020, was the twenty-fourth United States Census. National Census Day was on April 1, 2020. In 2020, the United States population was 331,449,281, a 7.71% increase from the 2010 Census. The Department of Commerce announced in March 2018 that the 2020 Census will ask if individuals are United States citizens according to a request from the Trump administration. 11 states (Connecticut, Delaware, Illinois, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New Mexico, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Washington, California) have said they would sue to block the Trump administration's request. ==References== ==Other websites== * 2020 Census from the United States Census Bureau Census Category:April 2020 events 2020
title: 2020 United States Census
